Info.Description: Generates Voronoi noise, also known as Worley noise. This type of noise is based on a grid of points, with each pixel in the image getting a value based on its distance from the nearest point. This creates a cellular pattern that can be used to generate textures resembling marble, stone, and other natural materials.

Properties.Name: Angle
Properties.Summary: Controls the rotation of the Voronoi cells in the noise pattern. Adjusting the angle can create a wide variety of patterns, from straight, grid-like cells to more complex and irregular patterns.

Properties.Name: Density
Properties.Summary: Adjusts the number of points used to generate the Voronoi cells. A higher density creates more, smaller cells, while a lower density results in fewer, larger cells.

Properties.Name: Gradient
Properties.Summary: This selects the colors that will be used in the Voronoi noise. The gradient is interpolated over the grayscale noise values. Each point in the noise pattern is assigned a color from the gradient based on its value, with low values taking colors from one end of the gradient and high values from the other end.
